content.raw: Make sure you're on the `default` branch.  Try `hg update default` and rebuild your workspace.  I just verified the worlds are present on the `default` branch.
content.html: Make sure you're on the default branch. Try hg update default and rebuild your workspace. I just verified the worlds are present on the default branch.

content.raw:
Is there some recommendation for docker users?

`./run.bash osrf/subt-virtual-testbed:cloudsim_sim_latest cloudsim_sim.ign circuit:=cave worldName:=simple_cave_01 robotName1:=X1F200L robotConfig1:=ROBOTIKA_X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_1`

results into

```
[Dbg] [Manager.cc:809] Loading plugin. Name[ignition::launch::GazeboServer] File[libignition-launch-gazebo.so]
[Msg] Recording to [/tmp/ign/logs]
[Err] [SystemPaths.cc:447] Could not resolve file [simple_cave_01.sdf]
[Msg] Loading SDF world file[].
[Dbg] [Manager.cc:809] Loading plugin. Name[ignition::launch::GazeboGui] File[libignition-launch-gazebogui.so]
Error [parser.cc:670] Could not find model.config or manifest.xml for the model
Error [parser.cc:340] File [] doesn't exist.
[Err] [Server.cc:144] Error Code 1 Msg: Unable to read file:
```

i.e. similar failure I have seen on CloudSim on the very first run??

thanks

Martin

p.s. I am using the latest dockers \(release 2020-03-23\)

content.raw: Arthur: Thanks, it works now. What are `simple_cave_03_1.tsv` , `simple_cave_03_2.tsv`  and `simple_cave_03_3.tsv`  files for?
content.html: Arthur: Thanks, it works now. What are simple_cave_03_1.tsv , simple_cave_03_2.tsv and simple_cave_03_3.tsv files for?

content.raw:
Martin: I just tested on the newest docker images released (2020-03-29) and I did not have any issues running `./run.bash osrf/subt-virtual-testbed:cloudsim_sim_latest cloudsim_sim.ign circuit:=cave worldName:=simple_cave_01 robotName1:=X1F200L robotConfig1:=ROBOTIKA_X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_1`.  Can you re-try on the newest docker release?  If you're still having issues, purge the `osrf/subt-virtual-testbed` docker image and any associated cache and pull again.

Paul: The `*.tsv` files contain the locations of tiles and artifacts.  These are used in the world generation process.
content.html:
Martin: I just tested on the newest docker images released (2020-03-29) and I did not have any issues running ./run.bash osrf/subt-virtual-testbed:cloudsim_sim_latest cloudsim_sim.ign circuit:=cave worldName:=simple_cave_01 robotName1:=X1F200L robotConfig1:=ROBOTIKA_X2_SENSOR_CONFIG_1. Can you re-try on the newest docker release? If you're still having issues, purge the osrf/subt-virtual-testbed docker image and any associated cache and pull again.

Paul: The *.tsv files contain the locations of tiles and artifacts. These are used in the world generation process.

content.raw: Arthur: I meant why there are  `simple_cave_03_1.tsv` , `simple_cave_03_2.tsv` and `simple_cave_03_3.tsv` files in addition to `simple_cave_03.tsv` ? Are there  `simple_cave_03_1` , `simple_cave_03_2` and `simple_cave_03_3` worlds? There is no corresponding `simple_cave_03_x.sdf` and `simple_cave_03_x.dot` files.
content.html: Arthur: I meant why there are  simple_cave_03_1.tsv , simple_cave_03_2.tsv and simple_cave_03_3.tsv files in addition to simple_cave_03.tsv ? Are there  simple_cave_03_1 , simple_cave_03_2 and simple_cave_03_3 worlds? There is no corresponding simple_cave_03_x.sdf and simple_cave_03_x.dot files.

content.raw: @{557058:14b7fd50-d65a-47a8-825c-fa89681d07bd} thanks - I created separate issue at the end and resolve it directly with Nate. It is working fine now for our team \(the release from 2020-03-29\).
content.html: @Arthur Schang thanks - I created separate issue at the end and resolve it directly with Nate. It is working fine now for our team (the release from 2020-03-29).

content.raw:
Paul: Those are artifacts from the world iteration creation process given that there may be multiple drafts for a single world.

Martin: Awesome.
content.html:
Paul: Those are artifacts from the world iteration creation process given that there may be multiple drafts for a single world.

Martin: Awesome.

content.raw: This is resolved, please reopen if this is still an issue or this reoccurs.
content.html: This is resolved, please reopen if this is still an issue or this reoccurs.
